conclusion: The problem involves a child sliding down a guide rail, using the principles of mechanics to find the ratio of the tension in the rope to the force exerted by the pillow on the child.
The diagram shows a guide rail at an angle α with a groove containing a ball. A rope connects the ball to a pillow, which is held by a child. The angle between the rope and the vertical is β.
The tension in the rope is given by \( F_{\text{拉}} = (m_1 + m_2) \cdot g \cdot \sin \beta \).
The force exerted by the pillow on the child is \( F_{\text{压}} = (m_1 + m_2) \cdot g \cdot \cos \beta \).
Set up the equation \( F_{\text{拉}} = F_{\text{压}} \).
Substitute the expressions for \( F_{\text{拉}} \) and \( F_{\text{压}} \): \( (m_1 + m_2) \cdot g \cdot \sin \beta = (m_1 + m_2) \cdot g \cdot \cos \beta \).
Solve for the ratio of the tension to the force exerted by the pillow: \( \sin \beta = \cos \beta \).
Using the trigonometric identity \( \sin^2 \beta + \cos^2 \beta = 1 \), rewrite the equation as \( \sin^2 \beta = 1 - \cos^2 \beta \).
The ratio of the tension to the force exerted by the pillow is \( \frac{F_{\text{拉}}}{F_{\text{压}}} = \frac{(m_1 + m_2) \cdot g \cdot \sin \beta}{(m_1 + m_2) \cdot g \cdot \cos \beta} \).
Thus, the ratio of the tension of the rope to the force exerted by the pillow on the child is \( \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} \).
